Package util

Class Coordinate

java.lang.Object
util.Coordinate
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Coordinate extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a tile on the chess board. This class implements the Serializable interface to allow deep-copying by the BoardInfo class.
See Also:

    • isValidTile

      public boolean isValidTile()
      Determines whether this Coordinate object represents a valid tile on a chess board. To be valid, the coordinate should be on the interval [0, 7] on both the x and y axes.
      Returns:
      true if this Coordinate object represents a valid tile.

    • shift

      public Coordinate shift(Vector v)
      Moves a Coordinate object by a Vector object. This method returns a new Coordinate object, leaving this unmodified. This method is identical to:

      new Coordinate(getX() + v.getXChange(), getY() + v.getYChange())

      Parameters:
      v - the Vector object to shift by
      Returns:
      a new Coordinate object translated by the vector v.

    • getAllValidCoordinates

      public static Coordinate[] getAllValidCoordinates()
      Returns an ordered list of all valid Coordinate objects. In other words, this method returns the set of all coordinates c where (c).isValidTile() == true for all elements and (c').isValidTile() == false.

      The coordinate list is generated in the following way:

      • Coordinates start at A1 (0, 0)
      • Coordinates end at H8 (7, 7)
      • Coordinates move across each coumn before going up to the next row (adding to x before y)
      Returns:
      a list of all valid coordiantes.
